newsitem.title: ZAMBIA: ZCCM Nchanga copper mine back to normal.
newsitem.headline: ZCCM Nchanga copper mine back to normal.

text.p: Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines (ZCCM) said on Tuesday that the situation had returned to normal at its Nchanga mine after a brief strike by underground miners.

"The situation is back to normal now. Only a few people were on strike yesterday in the underground shifts but the bulk of the copper is produced in the open pit," said Pius Mambo, manager of corporate affairs.
"We have not assessed the impact on production yet. We will have to see the numbers."

Mambo said there had been some industrial unrest on Friday but miners had worked that day, and the strike by underground workers only affected Monday's underground production, amounting to some 7,000 tonnes of ore.
Some equipment had been vandalised during the unrest, he added.
Mambo denied newspaper reports that police had been used to get workers back to work. Police had merely protected equipment and there had been no clashes, he said.
Nchanga is responsible for about 50 percent of ZCCM production. ZCCM copper production totalled 25,141 tonnes in August when cobalt output was 441 tonnes.
